name: Los Angeles County Department of Health Services
description: The second largest municipal health system in the nation, providing high-quality, patient-centered, cost-effective healthcare through 19 health centers, four hospitals, and community partnerships.

name: Keck School of Medicine Department of Family Medicine, USC
description: Developed one of the first HIV fellowship training programs in the United States in 2000, including community and academic settings experience.

name: Los Angeles County Sheriffâ€™s Department
description: Operates the largest jail system in the world and partnered on the only HIV Corrections fellowship established in 2010.

name: Los Angeles Area AIDS Education and Training Center at USC
description: Established in 1988 to educate and motivate healthcare providers in HIV counseling, diagnosis, and management, expanding to cover specialized programs including correctional and homeless HIV medicine, and PrEP.

name: UCLA National Clinician Scholars Program (NCSP)
description: A post-doctoral program launched in 2016 to train physician leaders in community-based research and healthcare disparities.

name: ViiV Healthcare
description: A global specialist HIV company founded by GlaxoSmithKline and Pfizer in 2009, dedicated to advancing HIV treatment and community support.

name: The Lundquist Institute for Biomedical Innovation
description: An independent non-profit biomedical research organization founded in 1952, serving as the administrative support partner for the LA County DHS Clinical Leadership Program.
